data.title: Kungliga begravningsplatsen, Solna
data.meta_description: Kungliga begravningsplatsen is a burial site where those departed from the Swedish Royal Family are put to rest. Part of the Haga Park, the site's history as a cemetery dates back to 1922, when it was first used as a burial site for the departed Crown Princess Margareta because of her request to be not buried in a church. Notable burials here include those of Prince Carl, Duke of Västergötland and Queen Louise among others.
data.text: May to Aug - Thursday 01:00 PM to 03:00 PM
